info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 1:50PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central McDowell and west central Burke Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 150 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marion, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Morganton, Glen Alpine, Lake James State Park, Lake James, Table Rock, B.R. Parkway-Little Switzerland To Linville, Nebo, Pleasant Gardens and Glenwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
